title: VOPK
subtitle: The Unified Package Manager
description: VOPK is a unified frontend for package management that standardizes software installation across Linux distributions and other platforms, providing a clean, intelligent CLI.
problem: Linux ecosystem has many package managers (apt, pacman, dnf, etc.) and languages/tools (npm, pip, cargo), making installation inconsistent and error-prone.
solution: A single CLI wrapper that auto-detects environment, translates commands to the native manager, supports plugins, AI suggestions, rollbacks, and works across systems and languages.
codeSnippet:
$ vopk install neovim
# Automatically detects platform and runs the correct native command

features.title: Universal Compatibility
features.desc: Supports 50+ package managers across Linux, Unix-like, container, and language-specific ecosystems

features.title: AI-Powered Intelligence
features.desc: Provides smart suggestions, conflict detection, and auto-fixes

features.title: Plugin System
features.desc: Extensible via scripts in ~/.config/vopk/plugins with hooks into core API

features.title: Safe & Predictable
features.desc: Dry-runs, snapshots, rollbacks, and developer-ready workflows

title: VMPKG
subtitle: Self-Contained Linux Package Manager
description: VMPKG is a cross-distribution, fully self-contained user-space package manager for Linux. It manages its own registry, cache, manifests, and installation tree inside the userâ€™s home directory, without depending on system package managers.
problem: Linux users have to deal with multiple package managers, root privileges, and system-wide changes. Installing software consistently across distros is complex and error-prone.
solution: A self-contained package manager that works in user-space, supports multiple Linux distributions, manages its own registry and packages, and provides predictable CLI behavior.
codeSnippet:
$ vmpkg install neovim
# Installs neovim in user-space from archive
$ vmpkg list
# Shows installed packages

features.title: User-space Manager
features.desc: No root required, everything installed under ~/.vmpkg

features.title: Multi-distro Support
features.desc: Works on Debian, Ubuntu, Arch, Fedora, Alpine, Gentoo, WSL, and containers

features.title: Predictable & Safe
features.desc: Does not modify system packages, provides reliable CLI output

features.title: Minimal Dependencies
features.desc: Requires only Bash, curl/wget, tar, optionally unzip

title: MaxyBot
subtitle: Modular Discord Bot
description: MaxyBot is a fully-featured Discord bot built with discord.py. It provides a modular cog-based structure with more than 24 cogs for moderation, economy, ticketing, auto responses, starboard, and secure encrypted data handling.
problem: Managing a scalable, secure, and configurable Discord bot with multiple features for different guilds is challenging, especially with custom commands and per-guild configuration.
solution: A modular, cog-based architecture that allows easy scaling, per-guild configuration, auto-saving, secure encryption, and owner-only command management.
codeSnippet:
python bot.py
# Loads all cogs and starts background tasks

features.title: Cog-based Modular Design
features.desc: 24+ cogs supporting commands, moderation, economy, auto-responses, starboard, and more

features.title: Per-Guild Configuration
features.desc: Automatic configuration saving with live updates per server

features.title: Command Management
features.desc: Supports slash commands, prefix commands, cooldowns, and owner-only commands

features.title: Secure & Scalable
features.desc: AES-GCM encryption for sensitive data and scalable architecture for multiple guilds
